metadata.title: CVE-2024-1551 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Set-Cookie response headers were being incorrectly honored in multipartHTTP responses. If an attacker could control the Content-Type responseheader, as well as control part of the response body, they could injectSet-Cookie response headers that would have been honored by the browser.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, andThunderbird < 115.8.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
